sentences.en: Further resignations are expected later this week.
sentences.cn: 本周后半周会有更多人辞职。

sentences.en: He accepted her decision with resignation.
sentences.cn: 他无可奈何地接受了她的决定。

sentences.en: He gave in his resignation yesterday.
He handed in his resignation right after the cabinet meeting.
sentences.cn: 内阁会议一开完,他就提出了辞呈.

sentences.en: He has filed his resignation with the manager.

sentences.cn: 他极其无奈地叹了一口气。

sentences.en: In the union office, the mood gradually changed from resignation to rage.
sentences.cn: 在工会办公室，情绪慢慢从顺从转变成愤怒。

sentences.en: Mr Maddison handed over his resignation letter with a heavy heart.
sentences.cn: 麦迪逊先生心情沉重地递上自己的辞呈。

sentences.en: Mr Morgan has offered his resignation and it has been accepted.
sentences.cn: 摩根先生己经递交了辞呈，并已获准。

sentences.en: She bore the pain with resignation.
She gave a sigh of resignation.
She handed in her resignation and was put on three months' gardening leave.
sentences.cn: 她交上辞呈后，却得到了三个月的园艺假。

sentences.en: The Council will meet to decide if it should accept his resignation.
sentences.cn: 委员会将召开会议决定是否接受他的辞呈。

sentences.en: The men trooped into work with resignation.
sentences.cn: 男人们被迫只好一伙伙地开始工作。

sentences.en: This morning, looking harassed and drawn, Lewis tendered his resignation.
sentences.cn: 今天早晨，刘易斯面色憔悴、疲惫不堪地递交了辞呈。

words.tran_cn: 顺从的；已辞职的；己放弃的

trans.tran_en: when someone calmly accepts a situation that cannot be changed, even though it is bad
